Description: Small pottery cup or bowl broken from a larger object, possibly a spoon or a multiple vessel; hand-made; made of buff, undecorated clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: The simple form of the object makes precise dating impossible, though it probably belongs in the furst millennium BC like the majority of the items preserved by Hake. See Bailey, Op. Ath VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations at Kourion.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
